result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W Neas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both counts are Concurrent with each other, with the same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in an amount to be determined in 30 days

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Comply with any mental health assessments and follow-through with any treatment recommendations made
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician & cooperate with the DOC on random testing for alcohol or drugs

No bars or taverns

No Contact with P.P. except for payments the def sends him (restitution).  The DOC can lift the No contact if they deem it appropriate

Do not operate a motor vehicle until properly reinstated
.

Take all prescribed medications as directed

Cooperate with any other condition deemed appropriate by the DOC

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
The defendant can serve the remainder of the sentence on Electronic Monitoring through Justice Support Services
.
Concurrent with: Both Cts 1 & 4 are Concurrent
.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Financial obligation owed is to be paid from all funds received into defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 16CM1349.

.

.
